case_title: PUSPA DEVI vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX
judges: A. P. Misra, M. C. Agarwal
legal_question: Whether, on a true construction of section 64(1)(iii) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, the income arising to the minor sons of the assessee as a result of their admission to the benefits of partnership is liable to be included and assessed in the hands of the assessee notwithstanding that the assessee had no income of her own from any source whatsoever to which the income earned by the minor could be included?

facts.firm_name: Messrs Malik Chemical Works, Bulanala, Varanasi
facts.minor_income_source: Admission to benefits of partnership in the firm

legal_provisions.primary_section: Section 64(1)(iii) of the Income Tax Act, 1961
legal_provisions.definition_referenced: Section 2(45) of the Income Tax Act, 1961

key_arguments.assessee_argument: Income of minors cannot be included as assessee has no other income to which it can be added.
key_arguments.court_rationale: Section 64(1)(iii) does not require the assessee to have other income for inclusion of minor's income. Accepting the assessee's interpretation would render similar provisions unworkable.

decision.reasoning: Income arising to minor sons admitted to the benefits of partnership is includible in the assessee's total income, even if the assessee has no other income.
